label: myoclonic epilepsy
definition: A group of epilepsy syndromes in which myoclonic seizures are a prominent feature.

label: FANCM Fanconi-like genomic instability disorder
definition: FANCM Fanconi-like genomic instability disorder is autosomal recessive condition associated with an increased risk of cancer, infertility, and hypersensitivity to cytotoxic agents.

label: GRHL3-related orofacial clefting
definition: Any orofacial clefting in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the GRHL3 gene.

label: epilepsy, onset unknown
definition: An epilepsy in which the type of seizure onset is unknown or unclear, making it uncertain whether it is a generalized or focal epilepsy. Seizures of unknown onset may still have features that can be classified.

label: TOR1AIP1-related myopathy
definition: A congenital myopathy in which the cause of the disease is pathogenic variation in the TOR1AIP1 gene. May include fatigable muscle weakness resulting from impaired transmission at the neuromuscular synapse.

label: Jeune syndrome - GRK2-related
definition: A form of Jeune syndrome caused by biallelic loss-of-function variants in the GRK2 gene.

label: SNUPN-related muscular dystrophy with or without multi-system involvement
definition: A form of congenital muscular dystrophy in which the cause of the disease is pathogenic variation in the SNUPN gene. The phenotype is typically characterized by a variable degree of muscle weakness, elevated serum creatinine kinase, and myopathic signs in skeletal muscle. Extra-muscular features involving the ocular, skeletal, respiratory, and central nervous system may also be present.

label: B3GALT6-congenital disorder of glycosylation
definition: Any congenital disorder of glycosylation in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in B3GALT6.

label: A4GALT-congenital disorder of glycosylation
definition: Any congenital disorder of glycosylation in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in A4GALT.

label: FAM20B-congenital disorder of glycosylation
definition: Any congenital disorder of glycosylation in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in FAM20B.

label: ALG10-congenital disorder of glycosylation
definition: Any congenital disorder of glycosylation in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in ALG10.

label: hemolytic uremic syndrome, atypical, susceptibility to, 7
definition: An inherited susceptibility or predisposition to developing immunoglobulin-mediated membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis.

label: furunculosis
definition: A skin condition that is characterized by recurring furuncles, lesions primarily caused by Staphylococcus aureus infection of the hair follicles and surrounding skin. Furunculosis occurs more frequently in persons with immune systems disorders than in the general population.

label: peritoneal carcinomatosis
definition: Cancer in which a carcinoma, usually of the digestive tract or female reproductive organs, has spread extensively throughout the peritoneum and causes tumors to grow on the peritoneum. Peritoneal carcinomatosis can happen in many types of cancer, but it is most common in people with cancers of the ovary, colon, rectum, stomach, pancreas, or appendix.

label: renal tubular dysgenesis - ACE
definition: Any renal tubular dysgenesis in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the ACE gene.

label: autoinflammation, panniculitis, and dermatosis syndrome, autosomal dominant
DNM1-encephalopathy and neurodevelopmental disorder
definition: A developmental and epileptic encephalopathy in which the cause of the disease is a variation in the DNM1 gene.

label: myelofibrosis, congenital, with anemia, neutropenia, developmental delay, and ocular abnormalities
methylmalonic aciduria and homocystinuria, cb1L type
myopathy with myalgia, increased serum creatine kinase, and with or without episodic rhabdomyolysis 2
neurodegeneration, infantile-onset, with optic atrophy and brain abnormalities
autoimmune disease with susceptibility to mycobacterium tuberculosis
neurodevelopmental disorder with dysmorphic facies, absent speech and ambulation, and brain abnormalities
basal ganglia calcification, idiopathic, 10, autosomal recessive
neurodevelopmental disorder with variable familial hypercholanemia
telangiectasia, impaired intellectual development, microcephaly, metaphyseal dysplasia, eye abnormalities, and short stature
myxedema coma
definition: A rare complication of hypothyroidism characterized by altered mental status, hypothermia, and symptoms related to the slowing of other organ systems.

label: myxedema heart disease
definition: A rare complication of hypothyroidism characterized by unexplained heart failure refractory to conventional treatment.

label: loin pain hematuria syndrome
definition: A rare and debilitating renal pain disorder characterized by chronic, severe loin pain with or without micro- or macroscopic hematuria.

label: isolated short stature
definition: A disease characterized by the height of an individual two standard deviations below the corresponding mean height for a given age, sex and population group with no known cause.

label: sudden unexpected infant death
definition: The sudden unexpected death of an apparently healthy infant under one year of age that remains unexplained after a thorough case investigation, including performance of a complete autopsy with ancillary testing, examination of the death scene, and review of the clinical history.

label: sudden unexplained death in childhood
definition: The sudden unexpected death of a person age 1 to 18 years that remains unexplained after a thorough case investigation, including performance of a complete autopsy with ancillary testing, and review of the clinical history and circumstances of death.

label: sudden unexpected death in pediatrics
definition: Sudden death in children < 19 years of age that remains unexplained after a thorough case investigation, including performance of a complete autopsy with ancillary testing, and review of the clinical history and circumstances of death.

label: trichrome vitiligo
definition: Any form of vitiligo characterized by a tan zone of varying width between normal and depigmented skin. This intermediate tan zone has more inflammatory cells, Langerhans cells, and melanophages than vitiliginous or normal skin. The number of melanocytes is greater than in vitiliginous skin but fewer than in normal skin.

label: generalized vitiligo
definition: Any form of vitiligo characterized by loss of pigment (depigmentation) in patches of skin all over the body.

label: peritonitis
definition: Inflammation of the peritoneum (tissue that lines the abdominal wall and covers most of the organs in the abdomen).

label: encapsulating peritoneal sclerosis
definition: A debilitating condition characterized by a fibrocollagenous membrane encasing the small intestine, resulting in recurrent small bowel obstructions.

label: AARS1-related leukoencephalopathy
definition: Any leukoencephalopathy in which the cause of the disease is a variant in the AARS1 gene.

label: X-linked syndromic complex neurodevelopmental disorder
definition: A disorder that is transmitted via X-linked inheritance and involves more than one phenotype associated with the central nervous system, including but not limited to intellectual disability, autism, and seizures (epilepsy), and also a distinctive pattern of other features including dysmorphisms and/or congenital malformations.
